quest_name: Dear <Ranger>! We have received information saying

history.location_text: Dear Ranger! We have received information saying that there is a secret base of the famous Peleng Lyakusha named Borzukhan on the uninhabited planet of Bonnasis in Procyon system. Right now we are planning an operation to find and destroy that base, but we need a sufficiently experienced fighter to accomplish this mission. If you agree, you will have to go to the planet of Bonnasis within 35 days. We already have a camp deployed on the planet, where our agents who will brief you on the mission will meet you. You shouldn't have any problems finding the camp; there's a radio beacon nearby. Your fee for this mission will round up to 65535 cr.
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
In the camp you were met by the agent of planet Earth.
- Dear Ranger, I am glad to meet you here at the planet of Bonnasis. My name is Carl. As you have probably been told already, your objective here is to locate and destroy a secret Peleng base, known as Lyakusha Borzukhan. The main thing is to destroy the base. At that you will most likely encounter resistance form Borzuklhan himself. If that is the case, you have the full responsibility of what to do, but it would be better if you mange to take the Peleng alive. If you manage to do that we will pay you an extra 1000 cr as a bonus. If you have any questions ask now and I will try to tell you everything I know myself.
choices: How do I find Borzukhan's base?
How do I destroy the base?
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: The mission objective is clear—locate and destroy the secret Peleng base “Lyakusha Borzukhan,” preferably capturing Borzukhan alive for a bonus. Right now the main uncertainty is *where the base is*; without reliable directions I risk wasting time in dead-end routes (like the coastal grotto loop noted in the previous attempt) or blundering into an unfavorable approach. The most valuable immediate information from Carl is how to find the base (routes, landmarks, known entrances, patrol patterns). Once I know the location/approach, I can ask about destruction methods and other context. So the best first question is how to find it.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning: The mission objective is clear—locate and destroy the secret Peleng base “Lyakusha Borzukhan,” preferably capturing Borzukhan alive for a bonus. The most valuable immediate information from Carl is how to find the base (routes, landmarks, known entrances, patrol patterns). Once I know the location/approach, I can ask about destruction methods and other context. So the best first question is how to find it.

history.location_text:
- This may surely become a difficult task, since the planet is rather large. Although I could still advise you on the locations, where, we think, the base is most likely to be found. The three most possible base locations are, in our opinion, the mountains north of our camp, the forest south-west of the camp, or the underground caves, which you can reach via a grotto in the east, by the coast. 
But, in any event, keep your eyes open and your ears pricked, it is quite likely that we do not know everything, so do not let this information misguide you.
choices: How do I destroy the base?
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We now have the three candidate regions. From prior experience, the coastal grotto route tends to loop/dead-end, while the mountain area is the most promising lead—so I’ll likely head north to the mountains. Before moving out, the most actionable missing piece is *how the base can/should be destroyed*: whether we need explosives, to sabotage a reactor, destroy a command post, plant charges at specific points, or bring back proof. That affects loadout decisions and tactics (especially since loud explosives can trigger heavy reinforcements, so I need to know if a controlled demolition is required or if there’s a quieter objective). Asking why they didn’t locate it won’t help me complete it.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning: We now have the three candidate regions. From prior experience, the coastal grotto route tends to loop/dead-end, while the mountain area is the most promising lead—so I’ll likely head north to the mountains. history.location_text: - Of course we are not going to send you there unarmed. You will get a laser gun and several grenades in case you run into armed guards. In addition to that we are going to give you a special explosive device with remote control detonator. You will have to find out what is the base's weakest spot and set the explosives there. But do not forget that the capturing of Lyakusha Borzukhan himself is no less important. As I've already mentioned we'd rather that you take him alive, for which we will pay you a bonus, but if that proves impossible you can kill him. In any event do not let him escape!
choices: Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
How do I find Borzukhan's base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve learned the destruction method: a remote explosive to be placed at the base’s weakest point, plus we’ll have a laser gun and grenades. The key remaining risk is wasting time in the wrong region or entering via a bad approach. Previous attempt notes indicate the coastal grotto route often loops/dead-ends and that the mountain cave is the real lead, but that’s my own experience—if Carl can provide any extra detail (landmarks, which mountain area, any known cave entrance, patrol routes), it can prevent a wrong turn and help me approach more stealthily to maximize the chance of capturing Borzukhan alive. The “why didn’t you locate it” question doesn’t improve mission success; more navigation intel does. So I should press again for any additional guidance on locating the base.

history.location_text: - Of course, we could have sent our people in advance, so that they located the base, but we do not have any agents who'd be experienced enough to do the job. We fear that an inexperienced trooper could accidentally frighten Borzukhan off. If he learns that we have detected his base, he will surely relocate it somewhere else, quite possibly onto another planet altogether, and we will have to look for him again. I hope you understand how important your mission is. By the way, we have some data about the possible locations of the lyakusha's base. I'll mark those up on your map.
choices: How do I destroy the base?
How do I find Borzukhan's base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Carl’s remaining information looped back to what we already know: the base location is uncertain and must be approached carefully to avoid spooking Borzukhan into relocating. We’ve extracted all useful intel: three candidate regions are marked on the map; we’ll be equipped with a laser gun, grenades, and a remote explosive to plant at the base’s weakest point; and we should prioritize capturing Borzukhan alive if feasible. Re-asking “how do I destroy the base” or “how do I find it” will likely just repeat the same guidance. The optimal move now is to begin the field operation, applying the key lesson: scout and proceed stealthily, avoid loud grenade use unless absolutely necessary, and keep control of engagements to prevent an alarm and escape.

history.location_text:
- Excellent! But before you start off, you must receive your munitions. You are not going to fight Borzukhan empty-handed, are you? So: you will get an explosive charge to destroy the base itself, a laser gun and several grenades. Unfortunately our arms supply is rather limited, since the pilot who navigated the transport that was supposed to deliver the arms here, turned out to be a Peleng hallucinogen addict and ended up colliding with five asteroids at once. I hope you are not hooked on anything like that, are you?
It's a long distance to walk, so we will give you a light flyer. It is pretty small and sufficiently shielded, so the enemy is not likely to detect you, unless you expose yourself. We will show you a picture of Borzukhan, so that you recognise him. That's it. Be careful and attentive, and good luck!
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text: You are sitting in a light flyer and contemplate where you should go.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Go to the east, to the sea
Circle over the camp and look around
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Our intelligence gives three candidate regions: east coastal grotto/caves, southwest forest, and north mountains. From prior attempt lessons, the coastal grotto route tends to loop/dead-end and wastes time, while the mountain cave was the real lead. Also, the key strategic constraint is not to spook Borzukhan into relocating—so we should pick the most promising lead and proceed with controlled scouting rather than noisy probing. Circling the camp might reveal something, but it’s unlikely to outperform moving toward the strongest lead, and it risks pointless delay. Therefore, head north to the mountains and start careful reconnaissance there, saving grenades for emergencies and keeping engagements quiet to preserve the chance to capture Borzukhan alive.

params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges

Flying away would throw away momentum and risk losing the location (or giving Borzukhan time to move). The mission requires finding the base’s weak spot to plant the remote explosive; a cave entrance is exactly the type of access point that can lead inside. I should return to the cave and approach carefully: keep the flyer ready as an extraction tool, avoid using grenades unless forced, and prioritize quiet, controlled engagement to prevent an alarm and Borzukhan’s escape.

history.location_text: You headed your flyer to the cave, when suddenly a group of pirates with laser guns ran out and opened fire at you!
params: You got a couple of scratches
You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Shoot the guards from the laser gun
Throw a grenade into the guards
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve reached a high-probability entry point (mountain cave). The immediate threat is an armed pirate group firing at the flyer. Flying away (3) would effectively forfeit the best lead and risks losing the initiative; it also conflicts with the mission urgency. A grenade (2) is very likely to be loud, draw more hostiles from inside the cave/base area, and recreate the earlier failure pattern where noise triggers a mass-response in a confined approach zone—plus we only have 2 grenades and may need them later for emergencies or to control a dangerous push. The laser gun (1) is the most controlled option: it lets me eliminate the immediate attackers with minimal collateral, conserve scarce grenades, and avoid unnecessarily escalating the situation before we even get inside to find the weak spot and Borzukhan. Therefore I should engage the guards with laser fire and keep the fight as quiet and contained as possible.

choices: Land the flyer and enter the cave

history.location_text: You landed the flyer behind a rock and cautiously stepped into the cave. In front of you there was a long corridor...
params: You've got a laser gun with 5 charges
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text: You went down the corridor. Several minutes later you ran into a ramification. One corridor on the left, one on the right. Nearby there was a door. Putting you ear thereto you heard somebody talk and laugh behind the door.
params: You've got a laser gun with 5 charges
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’re inside the base corridors and have hit a junction plus a nearby room with several people talking and laughing. Our priorities are (1) find the base’s weakest spot to place the remote explosive (not just anywhere), and (2) prevent Borzukhan from escaping—ideally capture him alive. 

Right now, option 1 (“set the explosive and leave”) is too risky because nothing indicates this junction is the base’s weak point; detonating in a random corridor could fail the main objective and also alert everyone, increasing the chance Borzukhan slips away. Option 4 (“go back to the exit”) is effectively abandoning progress and risks mission failure.

Entering the door (2) is tempting as an ambush opportunity, but we’re wounded and down to only 5 laser charges; if that room holds multiple armed guards, we could get overwhelmed and burn resources early, recreating the “uncontrolled fight” problem. Better to keep momentum and stay stealthy, pushing deeper to locate either the critical infrastructure area (weak spot) or Borzukhan himself. We can deal with side rooms later if needed.

So the best move is to choose a corridor and continue deeper; I’ll take the left corridor as the most likely path forward while avoiding an immediate, potentially costly room fight.

history.location_text:
Going left you ran into a row of barred cells. Looks like these were used to keep the pirates' prisoners. A guard slept peacefully nearby. "Right!" - you thought to yourself. - "Looks like even Borzukhan's pirates are quite undisciplined!"
Suddenly the guard moved and mumbled something incoherent. You froze in your steps, but apparently he was still asleep. Still you should keep it quiet so as not to wake him up.
params: You've got a laser gun with 5 charges
choices: Batter the sleeping guard with the butt of your gun
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I’m in a prison-cell corridor with a sleeping guard. This is a classic stealth pivot point: if I leave him untouched (choice 1), there’s a real chance he wakes up later, discovers intruders (or freed prisoners), and raises an alarm—exactly what we must avoid because (a) I’m already wounded, (b) I only have 5 laser charges, and (c) Borzukhan must not be allowed to escape. 

Setting the explosive here (choice 4) is clearly premature: a cell block is very unlikely to be the base’s “weakest spot,” and detonating/withdrawing now risks failing the primary objective.

Between (2) and (3): killing him removes the risk permanently, but it’s an unnecessary escalation and could still create noise/trace; plus the mission preference is to take key targets alive when possible, so staying nonlethal aligns with the overall approach. Knocking him out with the gun butt is the quietest, most controlled option that prevents him from waking and sounding the alarm, while conserving my limited laser charges and grenades for real threats deeper inside.

Setting the explosive here in the canteen would be a blind guess and very likely fail to destroy the base’s critical structure; worse, it would raise the alarm and give Borzukhan a chance to escape—an explicit mission failure condition.

Going back to the crossing is possible, but it just reopens earlier risks (the nearby door with voices/laughter, and previously explored left corridor leading to the prison cells). The canteen gives us a safe staging point and we still have one unexplored path: the left door. The best plan is to continue deeper methodically, conserve grenades, and use laser charges only for controlled, necessary engagements, aiming to reach infrastructure/command areas where a “weak spot” is more plausible and where Borzukhan may be located.

history.location_text: You opened the door on the right and went into a small room with a huge power reactor in the middle. Right by the reactor, at a computer there sat a Peleng. Seeing you he quickly jumped up and reached for his weapon.
params: You've got a laser gun with 5 charges
history.llm_response:
REASONING: This room is the first location that clearly fits the mission requirement of finding the base’s “weakest spot”: a huge power reactor is exactly the kind of critical infrastructure where a remote explosive would cripple/destroy the whole facility. The Peleng at the computer is an immediate threat because he’s reaching for his weapon and could both injure/kill me (I’m already wounded) and raise an alarm that lets Borzukhan escape.

I should not leave now: backing out wastes the best lead so far and risks the Peleng sounding the alarm from the console. Shooting is safer in the very short term, but it’s lethal (hurts the bonus objective mindset), potentially noisy, and could damage the reactor controls unpredictably; also it’s better to keep base personnel from escalating the situation if possible.

The best balance is to try a fast, quiet takedown: concuss him before he can fire or trigger alarms. That preserves the chance to interrogate/identify him (could even be Borzukhan or someone who knows where he is) and keeps the reactor room under control so I can plant the explosive properly afterward.

ACTION: 3

history.location_text: You are in the main reactor room of Borzukhan's base. The killed Peleng is lying at your feet.
params: You've got a laser gun with 9 charges
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve finally found a clearly critical structural point: the main power reactor. This is exactly the kind of “weakest spot” Carl described—destroying it should cripple the whole base, fulfilling the primary mission objective. I’m also “barely alive,” and the flyer is seriously damaged, meaning any further exploration (going back to the crossing) risks running into a group fight I can’t survive, especially with unknown numbers behind the door with laughter and elsewhere in the base. 

While capturing Borzukhan alive is desirable (bonus), the overriding requirement is to destroy the base and not fail the mission. The safest and most logical way to ensure success from this position is to plant the remote explosive at the reactor now, then withdraw to a safer distance for detonation rather than gambling my last strength on searching the rest of the corridors. Detonating the reactor should also drastically reduce Borzukhan’s chances of escaping compared to leaving the base intact while I’m too weak to pursue him.

history.location_text: You set the explosives onto the reactor and headed back to the flyer. However there was a surprise committee waiting for you there - Lyakusha Borzukhan himself a laser gun in his hands!
params: You've got a laser gun with 9 charges
history.llm_response:
REASONING: The explosives are already planted on the reactor, so the remaining immediate win-condition is: do not let Borzukhan escape and do not die here. I’m barely alive and my flyer is already seriously damaged, so I must avoid any action that risks splash damage or further wrecking my only exit.

Throwing a grenade at Borzukhan is dangerous in this situation: the blast radius could easily finish me off (given my condition) and/or critically damage the flyer beyond use, turning a successful sabotage into a fatal trap. It’s also unnecessary overkill for a single target at close range.

Shooting with the laser gun is the most controlled option: no blast radius, no accidental self-kill, and it directly prevents Borzukhan from fleeing. Capturing him alive would be ideal, but there is no “capture” choice here; the priority is ensuring he cannot escape and that I survive long enough to complete the demolition and extraction.

ACTION: 2

history.location_text: You grabbed the gun and started firing at Borzukhan. He, in turn, crouched behind your flyer and returned the fire..
params: You've got a laser gun with 5 charges
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

failure_reflection:
REASONING: I made two major strategic errors. First, I chose a prolonged melee takedown on the reactor-room guard while already wounded. That guaranteed more damage and noise; a quick, controlled ranged takedown (or disabling shot) would have reduced risk and preserved health for the final encounter. Second (fatal), after planting the bomb I walked back to the flyer expecting a clean exit, then chose to engage Borzukhan in a direct firefight while “barely alive,” with him having solid cover behind my flyer. That’s an asymmetric fight I’m unlikely to win.

Next time: once the bomb is planted, prioritize survival and positional advantage—get to hard cover first, break line of sight, and either (a) take off immediately and detonate from range, or (b) force Borzukhan out of cover (flank, use the environment, or only then consider explosives if it won’t kill me or destroy the flyer). Avoid extended wrestling when low HP.

Useful path info: from the main junction, right corridor leads to an empty canteen; one door is a toilet (dead end), the other leads to the main reactor (optimal sabotage point).

ACTION: 0
